oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Oak Ridge Community Relations Council Board of Directors to Gov. Buford Ellington.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter of support from Oak Ridge Community Relations Council Board of Directors. The letter asks that Tennessee legislators consider the peaceful desegregation preached by Highlander and that they ignore outside groups' argument that this makes them "communist" or "subversive." They implore the investigative committee to set aside prejudice including pressuring the first witness at a local hearing in Grundy County to consider how they might be perceived. The letter calls into question the accusation of a local postmaster that Highlander distributed copies of The Daily Worker.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Communism; Civil rights; Governmental investigations; Leadership--Study and teaching; Segregation; Labor movement; Communism and education; Postmasters; Witnesses
